TITLE: Step 4: Audit the Selected Sample
BTN_COLLAPSE_PAGES: Hide web pages to enter individual results
BTN_EXPAND_PAGES: Show web pages to enter individual results
INF_AUDIT_CRITERIA:
This section lists the WCAG 2 success criteria. Use the filter to show or hide success criteria of different levels (A, AA and AAA). You can select results as: 'Not checked', 'Passed', 'Failed', 'Not present', and 'Cannot tell'; and you can provide details, comments, or other observations made during evaluation in the accompanying text box.
If you have uploaded the JSON file generated from the Web Accessibility Observatory's online diagnostic service, you will find a list of the automatic checks carried out by the service for each conformity criterion, together with the result obtained for each of them (if the criterion has an associated automatic check): 'Passes', 'Fails' or 'Does not apply'. This information is for guidance only and does not exempt you from carrying out a manual accessibility check.
INF_AUDIT_SAMPLE:
This section lists the web pages you selected in the previous step. The web pages that are checked in this section are listed when 'Show web pages to enter individual results' is activated in the 'Success Criteria to Evaluate' section. You can show an individual web page that you are evaluating, or show several web pages at the same time.
The chainlink icon opens the web page in a separate browser window.
INTRO:
Record the outcome from evaluating the web pages selected in the previous step. More guidance on this step is provided in WCAG-EM Step 4: Audit the Selected Sample.
Note: It is necessary to enter the results individually for each of the web pages and for each of the success criteria. To do this, select all the web pages to be analyzed, in 'Sample to review' (in the left column); then, for each of the success criteria to be evaluated, select 'Show web pages to enter individual results'. If you have uploaded a JSON file prepared by the Online Diagnostic Service of the Web Accessibility Observatory into this tool, in the WYSIWYG editor of each criterion and of each page, you will find the result of the automatic verifications carried out by the Diagnostic Service at OAW line, based on a correspondence table between automatic verifications and WCAG conformance criteria, although the user will have to complete the criterion review manually. The WYSIWYG editor's notes are saved in the JSON file but they are not saved in the XLSX or ODS files.
NO_PAGE_SELECTED: No pages selected under Sample to Evaluate
NO_SAMPLE: No sample available. Create a sample in step 2 and step 3.
